metadata.title: CVE-2022-3910 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
Use After Free vulnerability in Linux Kernel allows Privilege Escalation.An improper Update of Reference Count in io_uring leads to Use-After-Freeand Local Privilege Escalation. When io_msg_ring was invoked with a fixedfile, it called io_fput_file() which improperly decreased its referencecount (leading to Use-After-Free and Local Privilege Escalation). Fixedfiles are permanently registered to the ring, and should not be putseparately. We recommend upgrading past commithttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
